full_text:
Page 868
Re: Epstein
From Shirley V. Skipper-Scott
To Lamine N'Diaye
Date 2019/07/24 11:54
Subject: Re: Epstein
Attachments: TEXT.htm
He is pending a Code 228, Tattooing or Self-Mutilation and I spoke with [redacted] who indicated that most likely he will be found competent because he is not mentally ill. Therefore, he will be pending a UDC hearing. I am looking at the SHU Roster now to see who can be a good cell mate.
Shirley Skipper-Scott
Associate Warden
MCC New York
150 Park Row
New York, New York 10007
Office: 646-836 [redacted]
Black Berry: 646-423 [redacted] @bop.gov
>>> Lamine N'Diaye [redacted] @bop.gov> 7/24/2019 10:47 AM >>>
Looks good
Sent from my Verizon, Samsung Galaxy smartphone
------- Original message ---------
From: "Shirley V. Skipper-Scott" [redacted] @bop.gov>
Date: 7/24/19 10:10 AM (GMT-05:00)
To: Lamine N'Diaye [redacted] @bop.gov>
Subject: Re: Epstein
>>> "Shirley V. Skipper-Scott" 7/24/2019 10:10 >>>
This is the response I am sending the RD. Are you ok with this?
Below is the definition of Psychological Observation provided by [redacted] Chief Psychologist. He will remain on Psychological Observation until tomorrow, where he will be reassessed.
DEFINITION: A Psychological Observation occurs when an inmate who suffers from a mental illness, a serious personality disorder, a medical problem (impairing their mental status), or drug intoxication and/or withdrawal symptoms begins to deteriorate. The inmate is no longer mentally stable and therefore, it is inappropriate for s/he to remain in general population or the Special Housing Unit (SHU). Inmates placed on psychological observation differ from inmates placed on suicide watch as they are not imminently suicidal (e.g., have not expressed self-harm or engaged in self-harming behavior), but rather, due to his/her impairment in mental status or functioning (e.g., not eating, not sleeping, disorganized/unusual thinking, poor self-care), his/her behavior can be unpredictable. Psychological Observation status is intended as a temporary status.
Page 1685

He is pending a Code 228, Tattooing or Self-Mutilation and I spoke with [redacted] who indicated that most likely he will be found competent because he is not mentally ill. Therefore, he will be pending a UDC hearing. I am looking at the SHU Roster now to see who can be a good cell mate.

Subject: Re: Epstein

>>> "Shirley V. Skipper-Scott" 7/24/2019 10:10 >>>
This is the response I am sending the RD. Are you ok with this?
Below is the definition of Psychological Observation provided by [redacted] Chief Psychologist. He will remain on Psychological Observation until tomorrow, where he will be reassessed.

DEFINITION: A Psychological Observation occurs when an inmate who suffers from a mental illness, a serious personality disorder, a medical problem (impairing their mental status), or drug intoxication and/or withdrawal symptoms begins to deteriorate. The inmate is no longer mentally stable and therefore, it is inappropriate for s/he to remain in general population or the Special Housing Unit (SHU). Inmates placed on psychological observation differ from inmates placed on suicide watch as they are not imminently suicidal (e.g., have not expressed self-harm or engaged in self-harming behavior), but rather, due to his/her impairment in mental status or functioning (e.g., not eating, not sleeping, disorganized/unusual thinking, poor self-care), his/her behavior can be unpredictable. Psychological Observation status is intended as a temporary status.

additional_notes: The document is an email chain discussing an inmate's status and the definition of Psychological Observation. The email contains redactions.
